content:
The chunk discusses several built-in global variables in Panda3D, including `globalClock`, which provides timing information, and other utilities like `vfs` for virtual file system access, `ConfigPageManager` and `ConfigVariableManager` for configuration management, and `PandaSystem` for distribution information. This context situates the chunk within the section of the document that details these global variables and their purposes in a Panda3D application.

The most common use is to obtain the time elapsed since the last frame (for calculations in movement code), using globalClock.dt <panda3d.core.ClockObject.dt>. The value is given in seconds.

Another useful function is to get the frame time (in seconds, since the program started):

frameTime = globalClock.getFrameTime()

A global instance of the virtual file system <virtual-file-system>, as a short-hand for VirtualFileSystem.getGlobalPtr() <panda3d.core.VirtualFileSystem.getGlobalPtr>.

Provides access to the loaded configuration files. Short-hand for ConfigPageManager.getGlobalPtr() <panda3d.core.ConfigPageManager.getGlobalPtr>.

Provides access to configuration variables. Short-hand for ConfigVariableManager.getGlobalPtr() <panda3d.core.ConfigVariableManager.getGlobalPtr>.

Provides information about the Panda3D distribution, such as the version, compiler information and build settings. Short-hand for PandaSystem.getGlobalPtr() <panda3d.core.PandaSystem.getGlobalPtr>.
